references: In this section, we describe the system model for asynchronous FL over wireless networks. The main notations used in this paper are summarized in Table I.

references: Wireless Network Settings: We consider a cell network with a radius of 100010001000 m. The server is located at the center of the network and the clients are randomly and uniformly distributed in the cell, where the path loss between each client and the server is 128.1+37.6â€‹log10â¡(r)128.137.6subscript10ğ‘Ÿ128.1+37.6\log_{10}(r) (in dB) according to [49], where rğ‘Ÿr is the distance from the client to the server in kilometers. The client transmit power is set uniformly to 0.20.20.2 W. We consider orthogonal uplink channel access with total bandwidth W=5ğ‘Š5W=5 MHz and the power spectrum density of the additive Gaussian noise N0=âˆ’174subscriptğ‘0174N_{0}=-174 dBm/Hz. Unless mentioned otherwise, the main parameters of wireless networks used in the experiments are summarized in Table II.
